page.title: 01Exmoor S of Dunkeny Hill
page.content: This is an upland block on Exmoor to the south of Dunkeny Hill. The northerly line of the block includes Dunkney Gate, a southerly 'entry point' to the height of Dunkeny Hill, and marks a change from farmland to the south of the block to the moorland plateau - heather & bracken covered landscape - typical of the more rugged aspects of Exmoor. A beautiful stream filled, wooded combe stretches from the moorland plateau at Dunkeny Gate across the north east of the block and begins to embrace lower - lying grazing land. Most of the southern sections of the block, south from Dunkeny Gate, move into farmland some unsown, but some sown and cut for grass and hay. The landscape is undulating, hedged, green, numerous trees but windswept. No amenity is evident; few roads; sparsely populated
